thread.title: Lyndhurst's Lady Bears lose heartbreaker in county soccer tourney
thread.title_full: Lyndhurst's Lady Bears lose heartbreaker in county soccer tourney

title: Lyndhurst's Lady Bears lose heartbreaker in county soccer tourney
text:
Lyndhurst's Lady Bears lose heartbreaker in county soccer tourney October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:04 PM By Edward Kensik staff photo/kevin j. riley Lyndhurst's Olivia Cairns (22) on the field against New Milford on Oct. 8. 
LYNDHURST - The Lyndhurst girls soccer team came in with plenty of momentum on Sunday against Paramus in the Bergen County Tournament. 
The Lady Golden Bears had avenged their lone defeat of the season with a dominating 6-1 win over NJIC Liberty Division rival New Milford on Thursday. staff photo/kevin j. riley Gabrielle Carrion of Lyndhurst (7) during the New Milford game. 
And the 24th-seeded Lyndhurst squad showed that it was just as good as eighth-seeded Paramus for regulation and two overtime periods. 
The game was scoreless and headed to penalty kicks. staff photo/kevin j. riley Lyndhurst's Joanne Arvanitakis (11) and New Milford's Caitlyn Magala (4) battle for control of the ball. 
The Cinderella run for Lyndhurst though ended in penalty kicks as it dropped a 6-5 verdict in penalty kicks. For the Lady Golden Bears Amanda Fulcher, Destiny Keith, Bella Montalvo and Kelsie Kearns made their penalty kicks as the shootout went to six rounds. 
In the books it goes 1-0 to Paramus, but Lyndhurst head coach Kim Hykey was very happy with the play of her team. staff photo/kevin j. riley Lyndhurst coach Kimberly Hykey talks to her players. 
"I am very proud of my team for their effort today," said Hykey. "They proved how tough they are and how much heart they have - they fought every minute." 
Lyndhurst goalie Izzy Castagnetti kept the Lady Golden Bears in the game and made six saves. "Our goalie, Izzy, had some outstanding saves," said Hykey. "She just gets to balls that most goalies can't. It's amazing to watch." 
In the victory over New Milford the Golden Bears broke open a 1-1 tie at halftime with five unanswered goals. Mia Luna had a huge game with four goals while Fulcher added a pair of goals and three assists. 
The Lyndhurst defense and goal keeper Castagnetti had a great second half and kept the Lady Green Knights out of their end. 
Boys Soccer 
The Lyndhurst and North Arlington boys soccer teams can chalk up their Bergen County Tournament games as experience as both were ousted in the first round last week. 
The Golden Bears, who were the 18th seed, dropped a 7-3 verdict at Cliffside Park on Thursday afternoon. 
While the Red Raiders were the 15th seed, Cliffside Park has won the county title in the past. 
Despite the score the Golden Bears stayed toe-to-toe with the soccer powerhouse in the first half, as the game was tied, 2-2, heading into the second half. 
Lyndhurst received goals from Vincent DiTonto, Luis Yoliane and Adrian Baranowski in the county game. Milton Rua and Douglas DaSilva made 12 saves in the battle. 
Despite being the 20th seed North Arlington stayed with 13th-seeded Mahwah for the entire game in the first round of the Bergen County Tournament on Thursday. 
But the Vikings could just not finish off as they dropped a 2-1 verdict at Mahwah. North Arlington's top striker, Cristiano Neves, scored in the second half, but it was not enough offense. 
Vikings goalie Ali Timur made eight saves to keep up with the T-Birds. North Arlington dropped to 7-3 on the season. 
While not the Bergen County Tournament, Rutherford is part of the Bergen Cup Tournament on the boys side. The Bulldogs were the seventh seed and defeated 10th-seeded River Dell, 1-0, on Saturday. Rutherford will take on second-seeded Glen Rock this weekend. It will be a battle of two NJIC Colonial Division teams. The Bulldogs defeated the Panthers, 1-0, earlier in the season. 
Junior midfielder Max Moran scored the lone and game-winning goal in the second half. Sophomore goalkeeper Armando Adler made a pair of saves to post the shutout. Â© 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
